answerText: electronegativity[10] Fluorine has a value of 4.0 on the electronegativity scale named for this scientist. He developed the alpha helix and beta sheet model of protein structure, and is famous for taking ridiculously large doses for vitamin C.
heading: MUT |2012 | 1 | 11 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The differences in values of this property of two atoms determines the covalent character of the bond between them.  [10] Name this quantity which measures an atom's ability to attract electrons. Fluorine has the highest value for this property.
